heading: TARGETED MUSCLES: Upper arm (triceps). WHAT YOU NEED: Hand-held weights or household items (soup cans, bottles of water). TIP: As you progress, use a heavier weight and alternate arms until you can lift the weight comfortably with both arms. This exercise will strengthen your upper arms. If your shoulders arenâ€™t flexible enough to do this exercise, try the Chair Dip.

steps.1: You can do this exercise while standing or sitting in a sturdy, armless chair.
steps.2: Keep your feet flat on the floor, shoulder-width apart.
steps.3: Hold weight in one hand with palm facing inward. Raise that arm toward ceiling.
steps.4: Support this arm below elbow with other hand. Breathe in slowly.
steps.5: Slowly bend raised arm at elbow and bring weight toward shoulder.
steps.7: Breathe out and slowly straighten your arm over your head. Be careful not to lock your elbow.
steps.10: Repeat 10-15 more times with each arm.
